str2: And, even, also, namely.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From phone; to emit a sound; by implication, to address in words or by name, also in imitation.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.
Abraham, progenitor of the Hebrew race. Of Hebrew origin; Abraham, the Hebrew patriarch.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To pity, have mercy on. From eleos; to compassionate.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To send, transmit, permit to go, put forth.
Probably of Hebrew origin; Lazarus, the name of two Israelites.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I dip, (b) I dye.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The end, extremity. Neuter of an adjective probably akin to the base of akmen; the extremity.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A finger. Probably from deka; a finger.
Water. And genitive case, hudatos, etc. From the base of huetos; water literally or figuratively.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To cool, refresh. From kata and psucho; to cool down, i.e. Refresh.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
The tongue; by implication, a language.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: To torment, pain; mid. and pass: To be tormented, pained; I suffer acute pain, physical or mental. From odune; to grieve.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
This; he, she, it.
A flame. From a primary phlego; a blaze.
